etymologies: early 17th century: from German, from Old High German hamustro ‘corn weevil’

definitions: a solitary burrowing rodent with a short tail and large cheek pouches for carrying food, native to Europe and northern Asia.

notes.text: Subfamily Cricetinae, family Muridae: several genera and species, in particular the golden hamster (Mesocricetus auratus), often kept as a pet or laboratory animal, and the common hamster (Cricetus cricetus)

shortDefinitions: solitary burrowing rodent with short tail and large cheek pouches for carrying food
